results.title: The Quick and the dead
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Joshua Donin, Allen Shapiro, Patrick Markey and Sam Raimi
results.brief_description: Ellen (Sharon Stone), a female gunslinger, arrives in the town of Redemption for a quick-draw contest. The contest has been the initiative of the town’s corrupt mayor, Herod (Gene Hackman), and attracts gunslingers from around the county, all with mysterious pasts. Ellen is seeking revenge on Herod for past injustices, the smooth talker known as ‘The Kid’ (Leonardo DiCaprio) may possibly be the mayor’s son, and the quiet Reverend Cort (Russell Crowe) refuses to participate despite being the fastest gun in town. As the contest continues all is revealed, leading to a final showdown between Ellen and Herod.

results.title: The Questioning city
results.creator_credit: British Travel and Holiday Association, Donald Carter and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: The university city of Cambridge, scholastic and social life, historic University Buildings, loveliness of the Backs and surrounding countryside. Sequences on the Cavendish Laboratory includes a resume of the outstanding scientific and technological achievements of its scientists and research workers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: British Travel and Holiday Association, Donald Carter and Eric Fullilove

results.title: The Question tree
results.brief_description: Dramatised incidents are used in discussing some of the basic elements of research, and to show typical activities such as cryonics, brain research, research into the living cell, language translation, and light amplification (laser). Points out that the key to progress in research is in determining which question to ask and which problems are ready to be solved.

results.title: The Question of television violence
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low and Graeme Ferguson
results.brief_description: Documents the hearings held in 1972 by the United States Senate Subcommittee on Communications on the subject of television violence. The four-day hearings established for the first time a causal relation between violence on television and violent behaviour.

results.title: The Quest of Nullandi
results.creator_credit: Cameracraft Film Productions and Queensland. Dept. of Commercial and Industrial Development
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the search by Nullandi, an Aboriginal youth, for “the everlasting waters”, with allusions to the experiences of a person living in another (non-Aboriginal) culture. Nullandi has grown up in today’s society and culture, but still feels traces of his past. He works his way through southern Queensland as he searches for the key to life.

results.title: The Quest
results.creator_credit: Communicator Film Productions, Michael Schildberger and Bob Talbot
results.brief_description: A promotional film aimed at interesting overseas companies in opening up industries in Victoria. Shows the Stock Exchange, the efficient public transport system, freeways, Tullamarine international airport, shipping facilities, resources of water, brown coal, natural gas and oil. Cultural and living conditions are also shown. Features a humourous narration by Frank Thring, as a very young Sue Donovan (Mackintosh) traverses Victoria (in fashionable 70’s gear) seeking artefacts to illustrate its attributes.

results.title: The Quest
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: The discovery of Insulin and the story of Dr Frederick Banting, practitioner, surgeon and lecturer from London, Ontario, and his young associate Charles Best, medical student at the University of Toronto, who struggled against the scepticism of other doctors, the press of time, the restrictions of limited means, and discouragement, to discover a treatment for diabetes. Shows how they persisted with their experiments on diabetic dogs until they lowered the high blood sugar content in diabetes by an injection of insulin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Stanley Jackson

results.title: The Queen, the chef, and the president
results.brief_description: During Prince Edward Island’s centennial celebrations one of the places visited by Queen Elizabeth II was the tiny pioneer Acadian village of Mount Carmel, restored as part of a winter works project. This film records many amusing sidelights before and during the visit, as villagers did what they could to make sure that everything - lunch in a newly built restaurant, entertainment on an outdoor platform - went smoothly.

results.title: The Queen opens parliament
results.brief_description: This film describes the 1957 opening of Parliament in detail and explains the significance of each part of the ceremony as Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, in her capacity as Canada’s constitutional monarch, convenes the twenty-third session of Parliament.

results.title: The Queen mother : 90 glorious years
results.brief_description: This video traces the extraordinary life of Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother using archival film and photographs. There is an interview with Princess Margaret, reminiscences from the Queen, recreations of her childhood, her wedding, the unforeseen Coronation and her tours around the world. Following the death of the King and the Coronation of a new Queen, she has continued to play a full part in the Elizabethan age, pursuing her duties with energy and warmth, and smiling her way into the hearts of people everywhere.
